metadata.title: CVE-2023-52515 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:RDMA/srp: Do not call scsi_done() from srp_abort()After scmd_eh_abort_handler() has called the SCSI LLD eh_abort_handlercallback, it performs one of the following actions:* Call scsi_queue_insert().* Call scsi_finish_command().* Call scsi_eh_scmd_add().Hence, SCSI abort handlers must not call scsi_done(). Otherwise allthe above actions would trigger a use-after-free. Hence remove thescsi_done() call from srp_abort(). Keep the srp_free_req() callbefore returning SUCCESS because we may not see the command again ifSUCCESS is returned.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
